metadata.Title: CVE-2021-24002 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When a user clicked on an FTP URL containing encoded newline characters (%0A and %0D), the newlines would have been interpreted as such and allowed arbitrary commands to be sent to the FTP server. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-24002` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required
